definitions.definition: One who is the progeny of a specified person, at any distance of time or through any number of generations.
definitions.example: The patriarch survived many descendants: five children, a dozen grandchildren, even a great grandchild.

definitions.definition: A thing that derives directly from a given precursor or source.
definitions.example: This famous medieval manuscript has many descendants.
Dogs evolved as descendants of early wolves.

definitions.definition: A language that is descended from another.
definitions.example: English and Scots are the descendants of Old English.

definitions.definition: A word or form in one language that is descended from a counterpart in an ancestor language.
Proceeding from a figurative ancestor or source.
